OK, I'm there 3 nights.  They'll get it tomorrow. I take a picture, sleep, up early, go to work (not using tub). Back that night and waaaaat? ITS STILL NOT CLEANED. I actually had to wipe it a little to make sure it wasn't rust or something, nope, blood.  OK.  This is getting gross. I do notice that they did not change sheets, and didn't vacuum since there was a shirt clip where I'd dropped it.

So they don't clean. And you know, that blood staining was STILL there when I left for good this morning. So, 3 nights, and NO BATHROOM CLEANING.

And you could hear the TV blaring next door, I had to turn the A/C fan on to drown it out. 

In short, if you expect a clean room, DRIVE RIGHT BY. 
Blood.  And they didn't clean it. That's a new one.

Check in was fast and friendly, explained Breakfast next morning, issued Wi-Fi password. Drove around to our room. A lot of what appears to be abandoned cars and vans parked in rear of hotel. Most covered with dirt, expired license plates, and some damaged. Apparently there is a car rental agency that has an office in the lobby of hotel but they seem to occupy more than 50 % of the parking spaces at the hotel. The room was nicely furnished with a sofa bed, desk with chair, King bed, dresser, flat screen tv, microwave, & refrigerator. Furnishing are older but workable. There were ant all over the bathroom vanity sink area and in the bath tub and walls. Previous reviews mentioned same issues, must be on going problem. Toilet seat was loose on the toilet itself so you had to be careful when using it. Do not know why issues with ants and loose toilet seat were not corrected by housekeeping staff. Room was very clean and enough towels were left for two guests. Air conditioner was efficient and reasonably quite. No issues with motion lights coming on at unwanted times. Only thing to remember, this is a lower cost hotel, so there are a lot of construction workers and possibly Section 8 guests staying here, it may not be the best choice for a traveling family. The pool and spa is large and appears well kept up. Breakfast was good, with standard fare. Hot sausage and egg patties, three types of cereal, good selection of breads & bagels. Coffee and juices. When checking out, noticed someone was sleeping in the car next to ours in the parking lot, again this car had signs it had been sitting there for quite some period of this, dirty with trash accumulated under it. Not a real safe feeling !! Upon checking out, we left a one of the maintenance notes from the room with the front desk about the ants and loose toilet seat. Seriously doubt we would stay here again if in the area due to the surrounding of the hotel.
Very friendly front desk staff. Clean rooms, nice amenities like the daily breakfast,  pool and spa. Easy check in and check out, rooms are clean, good wifi.

Usually the low budget chain hotel/motels are kind of shabby and have that sense of 'I have nowhere else to go' or 'I can't afford better'

This place is clean, well taken care of and kind of classy in its own way.

The owners clearly have gone the extra step to make more than a 'low budget chain motel/hotel'

I will stay here again when I come to visit.
NIce for a one night stay.  Breakfast not great.  Plastic eggs and sausages, no low fat yogurt, pancake machine nice.  Charge $.50 per page printed in business center.

Very nice, clean hotel.  Was impressed that the complimentary breakfast was more than just a continental breakfast.  TV was nice with a wide choice of channels.  Didn't get a chance to go in the pool, but it also looked nice.  Definite recommendation for anybody visiting Orange County, California!

The 1st night our room seemed comfortable even after we found a couple of ants in the bathroom. When we woke up Friday morning there were ants in our bed. Absolutely not acceptable & the desk person moved us to a larger room that had been newly remodeled. While the larger room was much nicer than our previous room it was definitely an  inconvenience to move everything as we had settled in for a three night stay.  We came back to the room Friday night fairly early as we had a very busy day ahead of us Sat. We decided to turn the lights off early to get some rest. Within minutes the light in the sitting area came back on. I got back up to turn it off & again it turned back on right about the time I fell asleep. Husband had fallen asleep and stayed asleep as he can sleep through most anything. The light kept coming on numerous times. I had tried everything with this sensor to no avail. Between the hours of 1 & 2 am I counted the times it came on (11 to be exact). I finally went to the office as I had called them earlier in the night and he offered to come check it out however I didn't feel comfortable having him come in while my husband was sleeping. So I asked for some masking tape or something to cover the sensor. He gave me grey duct tape and I placed it over the sensor so it could not read any sort of wind blowing or dust particle. The light situation continued through the night and I'm lucky if I got 2 hours of sleep. When the light would come on no one had moved. Not one motion for it to go off. They did say maint. came in Saturday while we were gone. However the light cont. to come off & on. Every time I spoke with a desk person they were very personable but honestly that is all they had going for them as they didn't seem to want to help me in any way other than apologizing. While that is nice I wanted SLEEP. I finally was told I had to speak to a mgr which would not be available until Mon. I left my # as instructed & waited for a call. I finally got tired of waiting & called them myself. Was told that she was on the line & would be off in a minute. I waited for my return call & decided to call again. I was told that she was on a conference call. I was asked to leave my name & # and I explained to that now that I know she was on a conf call that I would wait. Samantha called me back within 5 minutes as the mgr told her to call & handle it for her. She apologized & ended up crediting us one night. while that is nice it would have been better to sleep!
Too smelled weird.. cockroach in my bathroom.. checked on for to room.. walked back to front office and checked out!

Our stays at Travelodge Orange County Airport/Costa Mesa have always been outstanding
that is why we always stay with them.  It is our home away from home ...it is very comforting to know we are treated as family while there.  Than You Travelodge !
Easy check in and check out. Close to Disneyland, South Coast Plaza and other good restaurants. Hotel was old but only used for sleep. Too run down although convenient.
Ive been here a few times - and both times I had to change rooms.  It spelled like smoke and was completed outdated.  Beds uncomfortable.  Staff friendly!
I was impressed, not going to lie. We stayed in a deluxe room with 2 double beds. Super clean and very comfortable. Definitely will check here before booking anything in thw future.

Excellent value, friendly staff at 11 PM and 6 AM!
Breakfast OK, a little disorganized, but overall very satisfactory.
Will stay again when in the area.

My wife and I recently attended the CR Summit at Saddleback and needed a hotel that was relatively close by.  We had a rental so we could stand some distance.  We were at the summit for all of each day we were there so we just really slept and showered at the hotel.  We also ate the hot breakfast, which was a plus.  The room wasn't big, but it was spacious enough with a King size bed, couch fridge, microwave, iron and dresser.  We was clean and well kept.  The bathroom was small, but clean.  The shower did become disconnected from the wall, which was caused some leaks.  The A/C worked fine.  The only annoyance was that the lights were controlled by movement sensors so they came on and went off at inappropriate times.

Overall, it was a nice room for the money.  I would definitely stay there again.

I stayed at this Travelidge multiple times and was happy with the Service for rooms, breakfast provided and proximity to a choice of eating places. The rooms were clean and I liked they have a water fountain in lobby. Reception could be more customer friendly.

Great breakfast. Comforters were disgusting with feces on them. Bathroom was filthy. Carpets are gross, with dental pics from previous quests. Shower temperature would either scald or freeze you, with NO way to adjust it properly. Nice bathroom products. Was wakened at 9am by the maid pounding on the door, wanting to clean (check out time is 11:00am.) Management could care less. NO way does this place deserve more than a 2 star rating.

This is a typical travel lodge, you know what you are getting. We were a party of 3 adults so had a room with 2 queen beds. The room was comfortable with air con. A free shuttle works to and from the airport and it is extremely close to John Wayne Airport - Handy! A very basic breakfast was included in the booking. A very cool pancake maker made us great pancakes!
very average... breakfast was bordering on poor,  the pool area was nice,  overall it was a little seedy
Rooms need updating. Shower leaked and dripped and panel under vanity was broken. The room was clean and the location was convenient for our needs.

I was worried that being near the airport would be noisy, but I did not hear any planes in my room and only a couple when outside.  The staff is excellent and very helpful.  Rooms are clean and nicely appointed.  We were down for a family reunion and my brother's room faced the pool.  He said hearing "Marco...Polo" until ten at night was annoying but I am sure it doesn't happen EVERY night.  There are a couple of fast food restaurants across the street and I hear the restaurant next door is VERY good (This from my OTHER brother who lives in Irvine ) but did not have a chance to eat there.  Best of all was the price which, I found, to be a good deal in the middle of summer.  There ARE cheaper hotels but the reviews for them were horrible.  My sister booked late and ended up staying at another hotel which was almost twice as expensive.  Oh, and FREE PARKING too!  There are seveal very nice shopping malls here and in neighboring Newport Beach.

The hotel was okay. We had a great time with the pool and the jacuzzi. The staff there was friendly and help you whenever you need. But, the problem is there wasn't anything else to do beside staying in the pool and jacuzzi. It was for the business trip to stay. Other than that, everything is very close by.

Our stay at this hotel was overall good.  Check in was easy. Pricing was great. Location was fabulous it was close to everything we wanted. The only drawback was that the room was clean but there was something on the bed liner that was invisible to the eye/ The first night the room actually smelled like vomit but when we saw the maid we told her and she replaced with no issues.

Wonderful hot shower & comfortable bed after long day visiting family and enjoying Orange County activities!
Great Value!

The check in was a very easy process. The room was very nice, comfortable, and roomy. The breakfast could use a little work, but no worries, Bills next door has got you covered! The pool area is very inviting with patio tables, lounge chairs, spa, and even a gas BB-Q for your home away from home perk.

The room was very comfortable and relaxing. Lighting in the room was perfect. Enough light when you want it plus soft lighting when you desire it. The water pressure was great in the shower, sink and the commode.  Best stay I have had in a long time with all my travels. Looking forward to my next stay when that time comes.

I am sure the room had the same carpet from 1980;,to walk on it without shoes was risky;
No iron; no ironing board; poor condition bed mattress

I had an early morning flight and needed a convenient hotel with an airport shuttle.  I had checked around and finding an affordable hotel that would be able to shuttle me to the airport was not easy to find.  There were less expensive options, but once you added in a taxi the savings would be lost.  I had never stayed at a Travelodge as an adult.  My perception was that this is a lower tier chain.  My perception was either incorrect or this has got to be one of their best properties.  Don't misunderstand - this is not a luxury hotel, but the room and property were both very clean and nice.  The bed was firm and comfortable.  The TV had a feature that I have not seen before in a hotel -- pause/rewind/fast forward -- just like on a DVR enabled TV.  The breakfast was fine -- their were a couple hot items.  The shuttle was convenient and prompt.  All of the employees I spoke with were helpful and pleasant.  The only complaint I had was that the internet was not consistent -- I had to reconnect several times.  Overall I was pleased with the Travelodge OC Airport.
Great stay. Room has been re-done since our last stay and was excellent. Hope all rooms have been re-done.

Stayed here because we were flying out of SNA (John Wayne Airport) early in the morning. Was very conveniently placed near the airport, nice and clean also. The only negative is that they don't serve breakfast early enough in the morning.

When we arrived I went to take a shower, the faucets were large clear ones and they were filled with mold.  We called the front desk clerk and asked for another room, they could not give us another room so instead  they sent someone to change the faucets, there was still mold in the tiles.  The front desk clerk and housekeeping were very friendly.

My daughters booked rooms at the Travelodge Orange County for a family trip to visit relatives in Newport Beach.  I was hesitant because I'd never stayed at a Travelodge but booked a room anyway so we would be in the same location.  At check-in I was given a room that had just been renovated and it was very nice!!!   I also appreciated the complimentary breakfast.

The room was very nice. The parking was a little crowded but workable.
The breakfast room was too small for a motel this large. Difficult to find a seat, but the food was better than average.

Polite staff eagerly greet itinerant guests at this friendly motel, conveniently located abeam to John Wayne Airport’s runway 20 Right (formerly One Niner Right). No need for a wake up call, the 7:00 a.m. departing Boeing 737 is punctual as a Swiss train station. Nicely presented daily continental breakfast provides a good pre-flight start to any day. Rates are considerably less than the over-rated and under-managed Island Hotel. Use those savings to dine and shop at the nearby theatrically rich and eclecticly exciting  south coast metro area. Car rental on site.
     Next time…Father knows best, the colonial Bostonian 1-million mile AA-Advantage Club flyer always made this his first lodging destination when arriving in the OC.
The rooms smell like smoke, they don't leave the Ac on- so the room takes 2+?hours to cool down, the shower was moldy and falling apart.

Good location, great value, met our needs, not luxurious, great breakfast, get upstairs room to avoid elephants stomping around, refrigerator and microwave included, is a must for us; airplane noise starts at 7am, but not really bothersome

I recently stayed at the travel Lodge overall it was okay but some areas to improve on.The house keepers should stop knocking on guests rooms so early to change the bedding's One day I put a sign do not disturb then I left and came back at midnight only to find my room was never cleaned,bed never made and did not have a single towel. I had to go to the front desk after midnight to get towels for me to take a shower..Was there for 5 nights Pancake maker only worked 2 days out of the five.Guests were very upset.Answer no pancake mix !Supplies and stock   managers need to work together!

The lobby was beautiful and I wish they had put some of that money into the bathrooms.  Room was nice and clean but the bathroom tile was falling apart and the bathroom was so small that you had to leave the door open not to feel trapped.  We only stayed one night and didn't use any of the other facilities.

Can't go out front entrance will drag. But staff extremely helpful. Would stay again now aware of parking challenge. Rooms were comfortable and clean was issue w AC but not enough to complain about.  Mediterranean grill on sight. Extremely tight for semi.
Clean room very efficient  customer service  and swimming pool  very clean..front  desk willing to  help
Great to shower & sleep. Surprisingly quiet (so near toll road & SNA) and surprisingly good breakfast!
We enjoyed the availability of the Travelodge in conection with our Whitaker Wellness Insttitute visit

Cheap place to sleep and shower. that's it
If you are going to stay in the hotel for any period of time go somewhere else.  If you need to shower and hit the bunk it will do.

Better sleep here than at our resort!  Great pool and hot tub. Room was well taken care of and 'fancier' than we had expected.  We'll worth the price we paid and being a quick 5 minutes to the airport made it perfect for us! Will recommend and stay again. Shower temperature was tricky to adjust but not impossible.

1.  Room had strong odor of cleaning materials.
2.  Woke up in the middle of night to use the toilet only to find a roach or two scurrying around and another type of crawly bug I couldn't identify!  Needless to say, I didn't get much sleep.
3.  Breakfast in the restaurant next door was not very good and not very clean.  I had a sticky table!
4.  I let the clerk know about the roaches (in a quiet voice) when I checked out and all he did was say sorry and he would let the manager know.  Seriously??  I paid $163 for two nights for this???  UNACCEPTABLE!!!
It was simple and nice. Nothing special but we were pleasantly surprised when we found out that the couch turned into a sofa bed so our friends could stay the night after a day of partying.

It was a nice place to stay, but I accidently booked two rooms and they would not refund me.  I made several phone calls and pleaded for help, but they simply said no.  The breakfast was an absolute joke.  Don't waste your time.  I will never never stay at any Travelodge again.

Reasonably nice accomidations, Beautiful Lobby, Suprisingly Quiet (near airport) It was across the street from a large shopping center w Restaurants & stores.
Would have rated it a 5 except for the continental breakfast. We went at 7:45am and they had LOTS of bread for toast,  only 2 tiny cereal boxes, 1 frosted flakes, 1 shreaded wheat. I asked if they had any other cereal They said  “NO”. There were alot of people coming in.No more cereal than for 2 people, No yogurt. no waffles or pancakes. Most places have waffle machines now a days. It was free so what do you want.

Good hotel, very clean. The only issue was that the room on the second floor still smelled smoke. Why? Because the first floor had smoking rooms and the smoke travels up?.The attendant said they were all booked and there was no other room to change to. I woke up with headache the next morning.

I was a little worried about staying here due to other reviews. I had nothing to be worried about. This hotel is great! The room was great, bed was comfy, room was spacious (It was my husband, 11 year old, 8 year old, 2 year old, and me) and had lots of room, and the noise from the airport wasn't bad at all! The property was beautiful. Short drive to beaches, any food you could want (burger place next door is excellent by the way!), and tons of shopping centers. The breakfast was ok, get the eggs and pancakes, but that is the restaurant not the hotel. We only planned on staying 2 nights, but ended up staying 3! Overall very impressed!

First impression count!
The over all appearance of the place leaves a lot to be desired. The check-in staff was rude and shortcoming. Personally wouldn't recommend this place to anyone!

I booked two rooms & was given 150 & 146. Check-in was quick, but the lady wasn't very hospitable, no smile, no thank you for staying with us, she acted like I was inconveniencing her. Room 150 reeked of cigarette & they gave us a different room upstairs. My family stayed in the downstairs room & my parents took the upstairs. The rooms were fine, clean, & had toiletries and a mini fridge. Breakfast was next door at the onsite restaurant. It seems a temporary situation. There was a line of guests at the door at 6:30 a.m., but the restaurant was not prepared. It was inconvenient, because everyone was trying to hurry up and get something to eat before they had other plans for the day. Everything was still being put out, the bread wasn't fresh & the made to order breakfast took a long time & was tiny proportions. The man was very nice, but under prepared. The rooms was 20 minutes from the Catalina Flyer & served it's purpose for us, but I'd only stay here again if I had to because of the price.

There was a mixup with my rate and I ended up having to pay more than what I was led to believe. The front desk clerk that helped me was very rude and lacking compassion. Even after I started crying.  I understand that the rate shown on my confirmation  is the rate I was expected to pay, but I wasn't aware of that at the time, and felt conned into joining a program that ended up not benefiting me.  Then the room smelled like mildew. The sheets looked they were never changed. They weren't crisp, smoothed out and were super wrinkled. AND there was a hair on my pillow case! Gross.  Then the shower water continuously switched from scalding hot to cold every couple of seconds. So until I realized I would have to settle for a bath, I got burned in the face twice.  And despite requesting a room far from any smoking rooms I had to deal with the people in the room next to me and going out onto the landing to smoke cigarettes. I have asthma and I'm extremely sensitive to cigarette smoke and this ended up being a real problem.   Smoking should not be allowed within 50 feet of a non-smoking hotel room. These people were standing right outside my door and window.   And then the only coffee that was stocked in my room was decaf and when I called the front desk to request regular they told me I had to walk all the way to the reception desk to get it. I was in the far back of the hotel, just woke up and was in my pajamas...Not very good customer service!  Very VERY disappointed in my stay...too many downers.
Loved the room. It was clean. Maid service was great. Breakfast was great. Lot of parking. Front desk was amazing. Pool and jacuzzi was awesome. Definitely staying there again when I am in town.
Had a nice visit here. The only thing that bothered us was the bed. Too hard and very noisy. Staff was great and friendly.

Out of all the Wyndam places we have stayed this one has been the worse. We were very disappointed. One day our room wasn't cleaned. The next day no towels were left. One night we were kept awake by noisy, rowdy neighbors.

We got into our room 150 around 8pm and right when I opened the door I saw a roach run into the AC/heater . I told my kids we aren't staying in that room. We went to the front desk and explained what we saw and they gave me another room . We went to that room which was located up stairs. We walked in and I saw another roach . We walked out and I just said we wanted our money back. I had to find another hotel to stay in at 9pm at night . Never will stay at Travelodge again. The guy that helped me was very nice. It's not his fault he works in a roach infested hotel .

The stay itself was fine but I was called out of bed at 11:30pm to give payment information that I had given months prior. I was sent a booking confirmation and I replied asking if there was anything else you needed from me as well as some other questions and I never received a reply.
The lady on the phone was rude and short with me and gave me the feeling that I was bothering her, she then left her post in the middle of me trying to get confirmation if my emailed arrived. I had to explain everything from the beginning to the guy who took over. My emails never made it, he had to give me his private email to send the information over. I was told I would be contacted by management the next day which never happened.

There were a lot of random people hanging around, and all the dudes sitting on cars right outside my room did not make me feel secure in my room.  The room itself was very nice and obviously recently remodeled.

My 16 year old daughter and I wanted to take a trip to Cali and experience the beach, so I booked a hotel near the beach without spending all of our budgeted money. Travelodge has a decent reputation so I was confident that our stay would be enjoyable. I didn't expect the drug deals in the parking lot, the eroded door that left a gape you could see through, bumpy/caved in mattresses, nor did I expect mold in the shower! Disgusting. I shouldn't have to worry about our safety and health while enjoying a vacation. Observant, yes....but worry, no.

Don't let the low price fool you! Room was clean, comfortable and we felt secure during our stay. 
Would definitely stay again!

I had to catch a very early flight, so that was the only reason I needed to stay there. Room had a sour smell, felt a bit worn/grimy. But nothing horrific/disgusting and quiet enough for sleeping. 
Desk clerks were helpful, friendly, polite.

Wonderful. Had to fly out early from John Wayne; arrived near midnight.  Kind and helpful agent at front desk in well-lit, expansive lobby set me up quickly and perfectly.  All my phone requests were granted.  Clean room, Granite counter.  Amenities.  Quiet.  GREAT bed...all for a very inexpensive price.  5 minutes to airport or parking.shuttle.  Right next to Freeway yet little noise.  Will make this my stop when I return to OC

Stayed here for 5 days spanning a weekend.  Price was outstanding.  Room was spacious and clean enough. Mattresses were comfortable. Parking lot  appeared to be busy place. Good Neighborhood though.  Easy access to expressways from this location.  AC worked well.  Microwave and small fridge in room in working order and clean. Internet connection also very fast so I could do work. Would have preferred to not see the exact same framed art / picture on 3 of the walls in my room but that had no impact on the usefulness and function of the room.

This Travelodge is just what you'd expect from an economy motel.  Old motel, many coats of paint, but clean, with newer TV, microwave and mini refrigerator.  Also cute towel origami (see picture).  Breakfast was served in a dingy Greek restaurant with poor service and poor quality food which included scrambled eggs, bacon, and potatoes or pancakes.  It was not good, but you really can't expect too much from a motel like this.  This Travelodge met my expectations.

The place was ok.. clean.  Safe. The free breakfast was at restaurant next door.  Lady there was way less them pleasant.  I recieve 5 pieces of cubed potatoes with breakfast. Saturday my daughter didn't eat her bacon with her breakfast - she doesn't like it so I ate it.  Sunday morning the lady brings ky daughter her breakfast wuth no bacon. She's like oh she didn't eat it yesterday. I td her bring it I'll ear it. OK experience.  Hotel waa good but the morning breakfast experience was not so  good.. not sure if I'd stay there again.. room next to us played loud music all night and kept walking out in courtyard talking really loud at 1am.. room above us ppl were stomping around till about 4am..

Clean, fully equipped with everything! A little old fashioned, but served the purpose. Great Air Con, good lighting.

Wifi never worked in the room, but fine in reception. Kitchen was closed so glad to walk to restaurant next door which was like the place that time forgot!

Everything was served in polystyrene cups, bowls and plates! Not nice at all, plus plastic knifes and forks----- I thought we were camping.
Good for a couple of nights before flying out of John Wayne airport. A bit noisy at peak flying times with aircraft taking off

(+) Great location to stay for Irvine area travels. Room was clean and suited our needs. Front desk staff was very professional and welcoming. ( - ) Bathroom had leaky shower faucet and leaky toilet. I was attending a formal business event and presentable attire was a must, the lack of  an iron and board was extremely disappointing.

The front desk attendant was engaging and helpful. We arrived late for a quick night before an early flight next day. Didn't use the pool or have time to check the breakfast out but the room was clean and the beds comfortable. I wouldn't use this as a getaway motel but it served its purpose well.

This is the first time my wife and I stayed at a Travelodge and probably the last.  We usually stay at Holiday Inn or Best Western but decided to try here because of the price, wrong move!!!  Cleanlinest was not satisfactory and the comp breakfast was a joke. We had a chose of scrambled eggs with pancake of potatoes. The worst eggs I've ever had and the first day no potatoes!  The lady collecting the coupon was  only interested in collecting the coupon.  Cleanlinest did not exsist,  in the four days we never saw a person wipe the tables and when we were finished eating we put our paper plates and etc. in a plastic bag laying on the floor by the serving table.......yuukee!!!!~!!

Upon arrival we were tired and just wanted to get to our room. We found a sign at the front desk saying, will be back, take a seat. Nearly 20 minutes later a female walks through the door carrying what appeared to be coffee for two. We get to our room and its badly in need of repair. The shower would suddenly turn cold or hot and remain that way for some time before switching back. Breakfast was next door and we had to stop at the front desk to get a ticket. The breakfast was cold with small portions and the coffee was empty more than it was full. The last night we were there the room next to ours erupted into a drunken fight that lasted most of the night and resumed at 5AM. As we were packing to leave we found a crack pipe between the dresser and the fridge.

Service was friendly and helpful in answering my questions about brochures and my reservation (booked online).  Motel is situated along a business district, close to strip malls and restaurants, and is well-lit outside.  

The room had amenities I expected for an average motel stay (microwave, refrigerator, iron, hair dryer, cable TV, free wi-fi, etc.), and the rooms had modern lights and decor.  Noises between rooms weren't too loud or bothersome.  My room was well-cleaned every day of my seven-day stay.  I preferred to eat breakfast in my room, so I skipped the breakfasts.  Vending machines outside of the rooms were a nice convenience and not overpriced.  The only major drawback are the aircraft noises from the nearby John Wayne Airport, but I also chose to stay at this motel because it's close to it; a local family member told me planes don't operate from 11pm to 7pm there, but if you sleep in after 7am, be prepared for some noise.  Despite that, I would stay again.
Stayed here to drop off relatives for an early flight. Lower price than other area hotels. Clean room. Great mediterranean restaurant on site with excellent hummus, babba ganoosh, and samosa's.

The lodging was clean and comfortable, not fancy, but you don't expect that at a Travelodge! The Front Desk Clerk was nice and helpful. We parked our car there for $8 dollars a day and used the shuttle. When the shuttle was not available to pick us up at the airport, the motel covered the ~$10 cab ride back. I would definitely use this option the next time I have an early flight out of SNA.

My husband and I stayed here after a concert so we didn't have to drive 2 hours home. If you are just looking for an easy and clean place to catch some zzz's, then this hotel is fine. If you are looking for anything more, keep going. 

This hotel is located near several restaurants and easily accessible to the freeway.

I stay at this hotel often, at least 4 times a week and its not because its nice, but located near my office.  First off the rooms could be alot nice with little expense and im not sure why its not done.  So out of the rooms ive stayed in there has only been one tub that worked properly.  The other ones either do not drain and you shower in dirty water or you can not not plug it and you cant bath.  The wall paper is literally falling off the walls in some rooms and should be just removed and painted to look way nicer.  The toilet seats in some rooms, 136 off the top of my head is one that the seat wont stay up, so as a man you have to hold the seat up with one hand and blank with the other.  Also several rooms have dirt and mold around tubs which actually removes pretty easily and make the appearnence of bathroom MUCH better.  Some of the doors have up to a 1/2" gap, that light comes thru the door at night and so does the sound.  Pretty easy adjustment of the plunger mount on door frame to seal it tighter.  No garbage liners, i know its probably to save costs, but staying in the room and eating and disposal of foods after a few days isnt practical.  The internet is super slow, hard to complete tasks for work and most of the time have to use my own hotspot cause it is so slow.  These fixes wouldnt run very much in expense and would make visitors stays more enjoyable. Just some honest feedback from a frequent visitor.
The rooms a little  old fashion,  but  clean. It was very  close to airport which  I wanted.  Didn't  get a chance  to have breakfast cause I had an early  flight.  Would  stay again.
I have never stayed in a Travel Lodge. But I will not hesitate to go to this one. It was clean, comfortable and the staff was friendly.

Convenient location  Close to the freeways restaurants and some shopping with reasonable rates and breakfast included. We always stay at this hotel during our summer vacations. This time I was there on business.

It was a good place to stay for a night. After a long drive, all we needed was a good sleep. So we checked in here. We got a big room with two queen beds. It was neat and clean. There was a microwave, mini fridge, coffee machine and a safe in the room. In the morning we had a nice free breakfast in the restaurant beside it. Though the price was a bit on the higher side, but all the other hotels were more expensive on that day. The location was convenient too.

If your visiting somebody in UCI, and will be busy all day long this hotel is an excellent option. It is close to the university and there are some good restaurants near. Two things are honestly bad in this hotel, one is the breakfast, and the second is the wifi. But, for the price of the nigth it is OK.
Comfortable room with exceptional amenities.  Close to all major business areas as well as recreational attractions.

This is a great place to stay, the rates are fantastic for the area.  I have been very pleased with this property and the service.  Clean and well maintained, comfortable beds.
The maintenance needs a little work, its hard to keep up an older building, but they are trying.  They have a comment card in the room and I believe they try to do what we ask.

I should have looked at some of the recent reviews here.  Instead, I relied on the 3 star trip advisor rating.  What a mistake!

The place is a dump.  Here is a list of what's wrong:
- card keys to the door won't open unless you try 10x
- AC doesn't work
- Desk chair is broken
- bed is uncomfortable and itchy (bed bugs?)
- there are no cabinets
- the lobby smells
- did I mention the AC doesn't work?
- there is no iron in the room
- the phone doesn't work
- they give you a wifi password, but when you connect, it asks you for a username that was not provided

I was trying to save money by staying here thinking it was at least rated ok, but don't make the mistake I did.  I'm actually still here now, but I'll be checking out tomorrow despite having booked through Saturday.  

You've been warned....

overall good points location was very user friendly;accomodations were good rooms outdated but they were working on that on the negative side had a very loud neighbor and the consruction was going on in the parking lot right below my window  which was a nuisance but overall I enjoyed the pool and reasturants  right their
The hotel is undergoing renovations, yet it was very quiet.  I did not expect a full hot breakfast in the morning which was a pleasant surprise.  Also clean and comfortable room

I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times. I knew it was in need of an update, but it seemed to be a good value and location for me. The hotel was clean. But this stay, I was put in a room that was not only outdated it was very beat up. I found a hole in the wall, receptacles hanging out, very corroded faucets, and some very noisy neighbors well into the early morning hours. The wifi was very weak which will be a problem if I come back. On the positive side, the bed was comfortable and clean. I noticed on my way out that a whole wing of the hotel is being renovated. I will go back if I can get in one of the new rooms and the wifi is improved.

Do not stay at this hotel. Today I went to the Dr. To find out what all these bites were. I have had them since the morning I left CA. He told me they were bed bug bites. Fortunately I have not gotten any new bites since my return so I don't think I had any hitchhikers. I stayed in room 143. In addition to bedbugs, the breakfast the offer is at a restaurant next door where the hostess was unbelievably rude and the food was awful.

Great place to stay friendly reception very prompt knowledgeable 
Room service staff was very good and friendly 
Size of refrigerator should be big

This location appeared to be below capacity, yet I was given a room right next to a construction zone where rooms were being renovated. As a result, I was treated to loud hammering, loud saws, and yelling workers right outside my door in early in the morning. 

The room was riddled with cigarette burns on the carpet and sofa, and the bed had hair and food crumbs under the sheets. There was also some sort of substance splashed all over the bathroom door, and the edge of the bathtub was covered in cigarette stains.   The bathroom sink had so little water pressure that I was barely able to shave in the morning.

I was also puzzled by the fact that the employees allowed an unattended, seemingly abandoned piece of luggage to remain in the hallway near my room overnight. 

My stay here easily ranked in my top 3 worst, most abysmal hotel experiences.

I booked this Travelodge because of its location and good price. I found that despite the hotel being under renovation, the room was modern, the Internet was fast and the experience was good. To tell you how good the room was, I stayed a few nights later in a "swanky" hotel in Laguna Hills and despite its ritzy outside appearance, I found the Travelodge to be a better hotel experience! It's not much to look at right now because of renovation, but this Travelodge will provide a good low-cost hotel experience.

First and foremost upon entering the lobby I noticed a young lady behind the desk, she wasn't rude but she was not helpful either. I noticed she might have had some preconceived notions by the room she attempted to give us. The room was old, smelly and rundown nothing as advertised on the website it looks like a 80s motel , a tube television, old bedding and than to add insult to injury they require credit card and or a deposit, what is being secured here? I expressed my dissatisfaction immediately upon the entrance in my room with Ray the condescending attendant. It was to late to cancel, I can't sleep the room is nasty and questionable. I would never ever ever patranize this business, my husband is a gold elite member and I'm shocked he was refused a upgrade after seeing this room and being told the pictures advertised are for upgraded rooms , what a sham. I'm posting pics of the real rooms which I thought would look like the site but it doesn't.

I came her as I was working business during the day for a 4 day span of time. While the rooms are dated and in need of an overall, my room was clean, orderly and not bad for what I paid. It wan't a dirty dingy room and actually beyond the stale smell that went away once Turned on the air it was not as bad as others might say. That being said it was under construction, I was told the work out facility was closed, and breakfast was next door not but decent still. Looks like one whole section is being updated but no problems with noise here either. The staff was great and the pool and spa enjoyable. For being directly by the airport because I was only there at night I never had a problem with noise. The bed was comfortable and it met my needs. For a solo business trip overall not bad for the price, probably would stay here with my family but still not bad. I needed something I forgot and the staff at the office went out of there way to help, even left something behind and after calling they had it ready to pick up the next day. Good experience! Plus free wi-fi and hot breakfast (standard eggs, potato, meat, pancakes but more than i expected plus cereal and pastries).
Air conditioning didn't work in the room and one of the shower head made a loud screaming like air noise.

I'm going to rate this place high, but people directly next to us in room 127 were up partying ALL night. I called front desk but did not appear they did anything, so my room was great but my stay was miserable
Room was nice but smelled really bad of cigarettes and also really bad noise due to being next to the stairs.
The room was very clean the front desk girl is always pleasant and very professional and a pleasure to do business with.

This lodge was better than some, it was under renovation, and that area was fenced off and taped off. The room we had was clean and updated. The towel paper holder was about 3 inches from the floor. However, everything was available including luggage holder, microwave, fridge, several chairs, and it was nice for a one night stay. Didn't hear any outside noise on a Thursday night, as other guests had written. The price was a little steep, but with the fair in town, maybe not. And a number of rooms under renovation, maybe making up for that

Room was clean and average priced. Check in was quick and the staff was courteous. The bed was comfortable. We almost chose another hotel because of some bad reviews, but since it was only one night and close to where we were going, we decided to try it. I would stay there again. our room was in the back, which I wasn't too crazy about, but there didn't seem to be any issues.

I chose the hotel for our last night of vacation to be near the airport. From what I observed they are doing renovations. Hopefully, it will help. Overall nothing too bad it was quiet and basically clean. It has very old furnishings and bathroom fixtures but everything was operational. We swam in the pool the hot tub looked a little if-y. But we got to the airport in 5 min at 6am which was the whole reason we were there. The people who worked there were all very friendly and helpful.

We originally booked 5 days. We ended stayed one night. Hotel does not look good. Next morning, construction workers opened our room up with key. No privacy. I don't care if someone is staying in there they should knock and have courtesy rather than open the door up. We checked out immediately. We were not happy.

The room smelled bad. I think the carpet hasnt been deodorized in sometime.
The covers were dark and not appealing. Its ok though because i chose the hotel because of the pool and the proximity of the beach. Breakfast was good and all employees we encountered were pleasant. Front desk attendant was helpful. This was 4th of july.

Great customer service with a warm greeting as you enter the lobby! Though the carpets are a little soiled but overall a comfortable stay. They're remodeling sections of the property and I'm looking forward to seeing the improvements.

I first received a room that had a tobacco odor although I was told it should not have. I was put into another room without the odor but with a refrigerator that could not be temperature controlled. In a few days I was asked if I would mind changing rooms so the bathtub in my room could be repaired. I then moved to another room, and everything worked well. The laundry facility was good, as was the pool and spa. Although I rarely took advantage of it due to my schedule, the free breakfast each morning was a very nice touch. All hotel personnel were friendly and helpful and it was nice having a microwave and refrigerator in the room. The value was much better than a lot of surrounding hotels.

The room was very nice, the staff was nice and helpful. The price was reasonable for the area. The Internet was very slow and spotty. I appreciated that they gave a voucher for breakfast while the room is being remodeled. The only negative comment is the number of cars that are parked on the outside row, I think they may be rental cars but many appear not to have been driven in a while. One had at least one flat tire and layers of dirt on it.

We were put in the back of the property.  There were at least six cars parked back there with no plates on them, (they looked to be abandoned or stolen) and three-four others that were obvious derelicts-flat tires, cobwebs, or under disintegrating tarps, etc.  It was obvious that no effort was made to clean this up.  Additionally, upon returning in the evening, there was a profusion of unsavory characters hanging out, arguing among themselves, and watching you come and go. I even walked over to one individual, who walked away from our room upon driving up, and who later got in a car and stopped and watched us unload.  He drove off.  I am a retired Sheriff's Officer, and I could not recommend ANYONE staying here.  Additionally, the room was FILTHY, the shower was almost inoperable-no control over hot/cold.  I have never been so glad to have been armed.  You take your life in your hands here.
Very spacious, well kept. No ventilation in bathroom however. Although labeled non-smoking, it definitely had a heavy smoking scent ...

Great Staff! They were super helpful and attentive. From the front staff, to the cleaning staff to the driver that drove us to the airport on the 18th of May. 
They were a fantastic group and made the stay so easy. 
The breakfast was great-but limited. I would have liked more healthy choices instead of just eggs/hashbrowns/pancakes. Oatmeal or fruit would been nice but because of the remodeling, we understand the situation. The restaurant Bill's Burgers was excellent as well. They were very nice and very welcoming.

Costa Mesa Travelodge is undergoing some renovations. The new rooms, if you get booked in one, are very nice; however, if you were unlucky like I was, you'll be put in a beat-up, stained room that dates easily to the 1950s. Though the guestroom was clean when I arrived, there were strange reddish-brown stains on the ceiling, the shower was very old and made high pitched noises when turned on, the guest in the neighboring room was smoking in the non-smoking section, and I was confronted with insects throughout the room. When I called the front desk to inquire about cab service in the area, the receptionist flatly said that she "didn't know about this" and hung up on me. 

Travelodge Costa Mesa should not be booking guests in their old rooms. It wouldn't be as big of a deal, except that I found out about the new rooms through colleagues who were also staying at the hotel, booked in the new rooms at the same price that I paid.

This was my worst hotel experience , dirty , smoke smell,old carpets, room stinks, very old and damage furniture, trash under the bed, spurs of very hot water at the time of showering I had to use the ice bucket to rinse to prevent burn eruptions on my skin, towels like sandpaper, no continental breakfast, No laundry after 9:00 pm

From desk not interested in helping,  huge pot holes in parking driveway,
Suttle not available etc terrible service it seems that they are going  out of business.

Overall nice room. The staff are friendly and very accommodating. I think for the price this is a lovely place to stay with convenience to Newport, Huntington and Laguna Beaches. Also make sure you try out TK Burgers on Bristol St. when you stay at this hotel. Delicious Burgers and awesome staff as well. I will be staying at this hotel again and again.

This place is a joke! The bathroom was old and rusty. The handles for the shower were laden with rust inside. The drain was black. The tile was dirty. The plug shorted out every time I used it. Try flat ironing your hair with the iron shorting out every couple of minutes. The lights would turn off everytime I plugged something in. I would then spend a few minutes trying to keep the lights on. 
There was no air-conditioning in the rooms. It gets hot in those rooms! Also, i thought there was breakfast included. They failed to mention to me when I checked in that their breakfast room was under construction. Whick is 2 rooms together to make the breakfast area. I had to go to the lobby in the morning, get a voucher then go next door for breakfast ( a restaurant). Didn't have time to wait for the restaurant to cook the oe of 2 meals you can choose from.
Don't be fooled by the decent looking lobby. The whole place is under construction. They even turned off the water for 2 days from 11-5. To top it off there is no elevator. Alot of fun going up the stairs with my big suitcase to the 2nd floor.
The location however was perfect for my needs. I was there for business. That's the only positive thing I can say.

used points again and was not given the room reserved. at first was put in the construction area. AGAIN.....disappointed. I wish for once it would all go smooth. Thinking about trying another hotel chain. Sorry.

Very nice hotel. The only thing is that it seems that the parking has become over crowed and i see the same vehicles there every time i have stayed. Seems like a lot of work trucks and cars. So it has made it hard to park close to your room sometimes.  But i still enjoy my stay each time.
Overall I liked this motel however I had reserved a smoking room and did not get. Friendly friendly front desk girl.

Room was clean and staff pleasant but other than that, not so good. TV remote did not work well and I couldn't charge any devices because the two accessible outlets would not hold a plug - they simply fell out when I tried to plug anything in. Also service did not leave towels

I do not like because it under repair. 
I have to check in and come in in two seperated work. 

The room is dirty and old.
I do not try breakfast because they ask me to go to another place.
The air condition is old and noise.
The hotel is nearby airport so sometime you have to awake because of the airjet noise

I had stayed at this hotel before and it was ok for the price. I work in SoCal so I stayed for 6 days. I don't know what happened but this hotel has gone dramatically downhill. Dirty room, questionable bed linens, old bagels, brown bananas, no moisturizer, shampoo and coffee in the room each day.  The last night the hotel caught fire and they relocated me to the Starr Inn that was about 10 times worse (if you can believe it).  A hooker-like hotel. Absolutely disgusting.  I will never stay at this hotel again.
If I can get the right price online, when needed I pick this Travelodge to stay in.  I can't believe how nice the rooms are now after remodeling and glad the price was reasonable.

I've stayed here several times, however recently I have noticed that perhaps some maintenance is being ignored.  Toilet and sink both slow draining. Parking is problem because of rental cars taking spaces (car rental is tenant) and more than usual guest noise from adjoining room at odd hours, i.e. 3 a.m.  Desk personnel were cordial and friendly, but "free" breakfast marginal, at best, providing few choices.  Can't beat the price, but really superficial.  Room was clean and internet access good..

This is a Travelodge, It's not a Ritz Carlton. If you don't confuse the too, you will find this to be a good value. The room I was in (215) appears to have been redone recently. It faces the golf course, so traffic noise was not an issue. I needed to a place sleep, as I was attending a seminar at the Westin South Coast Plaza (about ten minutes away) the next morning, and I wasn't interesting in spening the $200+ that the Westin was chargin for a room. This Travelodge serves breakfast, but I did not have time to try it so I can't comment on it. I would surely stay here again if in needed a hotel in the area.

I chose this hotel because I had an early flight out of Orange County Airport, it was the closest hotel I could find. Based on the price I had expected it to be less, but the room are clean an comfortable, the whole building is well maintained and decorated, friendly service, breakfast included and a shuttle service to and from the airport (not on Sundays). I was pleasantly surprised with the quality I got for my money.

We needed a clean and quiet place for a good night's sleep before an athletic event.  The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and the complimentary breakfast helped us get on our way quickly.  It was what wee needed.

I had room #136 for only one night , The basic's  .. check in was easy, the front desk clerk very friendly and gave me a free upgrade. 
The room appeared to be neat and clean , bed comfortable.  I had to check out early . later that night when I arrived home, I noticed several bites on my body.  ( I did not stay at another hotel before or after)  I did wait 3 days to call thinking the irritations would go away. When I called the hotel back I spoke to the front desk clerk "Cynithia" who didn't seem concerned . She took my number and when I mentioned doing an online review her attitude was "Whatever" 
I did not try the breakfast , The positives, across the street from fast food and 7-11 .
I LOVE  staying at Travellodge  but will NEVER return to this one .
The room was clean and pretty nice but the mattress wasn't the best feeling to me and the breakfast was a little disappointing :/
Everything was GREAT, except for the insect I saw in the bathroom and breakfast was not that good.

The Costa Mesa Travelodge is the best place for miles around for a budget business traveler. The staff are very amenable and service is pretty good. It isn't too clean but acceptable. 
And like I said price and location can't be beat.

The staff was courteous. We were there for a week, originally, but left early because we never got a good nights' sleep. The airport is right there and planes take off and land until 11:00p.m. O.k. if you are traveling and want to stay for one night.  It was clean but noisy with a dog barking and people outside our room late at night. We stayed because of the price, but never again.,
Clean and convenient.  Didn't like that there was no elevator and no downstairs rooms available.  Wifi was very weak.

I booked 2 months out, I cancelled 1 month out and received a cancellation number. 1 month later I was charged for the first night and got a notification of a no show. I called back with my cancellation number and they claim they never received it.

I stayed here in order to catch an early morning flight out of the Orange County Airport.  The people are nice, the room was clean, but the whole thing is just a bit worn out.  

I will most likely use this hotel again.  I thought the people were nice.  The location is great.  But, breakfast was minimal, the internet was slow and the place is showing the signs of age.

Just a bit of airport noise....
my fami;ly stayed at the Travelodge.it was a great experience. it is conventily located to all our destinations, the price was very good.  I highly rercommend staying there,

We stayed here for one week as my husband was here on business. The pool was clean, the room was clean, bed was very comfortable. Added bonus to have a fridge and coffee in-room, a barbeque area by the pool, and free continental breakfast. Lots of restaurant choices within easy walking distance, and convenience stores right across the street. The beach and shopping were an affordable cab ride away. The hotel offers free shuttle to certain destinations which is a nice touch if they remember to come pick you up. This is not a frilly hotel but certainly affordable and a great place to hang your hat and tour the area. Note: very close to the airport so there is a lot of plane traffic noise in the daytime hours. No sound problems in the evenings or during the night.

As always i had a great stay. I love that they read there request and honored it. This is a great place to stay and close to the airport and fwys. Easy to get to the the front desk clerks are all great.

Horrible Customer Service
Filthy Room. I discovered live cock roaches on the bed and walls
Dirty sheets/Bedding
Hair and debris on bathroom floor

I expected my room to be on the same scale as the lobby.  The lobby was very nice.... my room, not so nice. I like a bright room and because I'm a woman traveling alone, I need for the light to be produced by indoor lighting. I turned on the lights and noticed that one lamp was unplugged.  The outlet was behind the bed.  When I tried to plug it in, the headboard fell off.  The room remained somewhat dark, even in the sink/vanity area while I was getting ready for an event and trying to do my makeup.  The ceiling was stained and basically, the room itself just looked old and beat up.  It was clean so housekeeping should be commended. It was a very, very hot night and I needed to have the air conditioning on.  Unfortunately, I couldn't adjust the direction of the air vents and they blew directly on me when I was in bed. Not good! Not good at all!  It took me hours to fall asleep.  Also, all of the pillows were the exact same size, none of which were good for my neck and the sheets couldn't have been any rougher.  I'm sorry to be so negative but it was a pretty miserable night for me.  ON THE UP SIDE - The price was right and the grounds seemed to be safe!!  The location was good and there were plenty of convenient restaurants nearby, including a drive thru Starbucks right across the street.  I appreciated having this Travelodge as an available option to me who needed a place at the last minute and even more, I sincerely appreciate the fact that you still offer smoking rooms to your guests who smoke!  For that fact alone, if I needed to come to the area again, I may stay here (but I'd bring my own sheets and pillow.)

I was on work/business trip and wanted a place to stay long term. This was good enough for a week. Then I moved over to anothe rmotel where they had a kitchen so that I can cook and not eat out everyday.

Great customer service can erase a lot of things… but in this case I feel like customers should know what I'm about to tell. For your own health…

I flew into OC to stay with my best friend and cousin while she was receiving cancer treatments. Note: this hotel is a "recommended hotel" for the particular treatment center that she was attending. After a long day and late night we were both exhausted. I climbed into my bed turned off the lights… several times in the night, with my face buried in my pillow I smelled something sort of putrid. In the morning I awoke and smelled it again and lifted myself up to look at my pillow which stained and dirty… I asked my cousin if slept in the bed the night before (as she had arrived a day earlier than I), thinking that maybe she had bad morning breath or BO or something. She said no. I then climbed out of bed to look at the sheets and I had been sleeping in sheets that had fairly fresh stains of blood and bodily fluid at the level of my torso. I picked the pillow up and there were blood splatters and stains on the sheets under the pillow. At this point, I felt sick, and worried, given that this is a hotel used for disease center patients. 

I asked the cleaning lady to look at it and she routinely changed the sheets. I then talked to the hotel staff who had a maintenance person come in, unsheet the now fresh sheeted bed, and look at the mattress. There was a deep, dark stain. He immediately got help and they took the mattress out and brought a new one in.

First, how could the cleaning people ever miss this?! It was fresh, and a very large area and a prominent stain. Not faint at all. Some staff person looked at the bed and looked the other way, not wanting to deal with it, or simply didn't care to change the sheets after a room had been used. 

I'm sure I'm fine, but I'm haunted by this experience. This was the worst filthy hotel experience I've ever had. And I'll check the sheets carefully in every hotel I stay in from now on.

I had constant offers for room service, I was fairly clean so I didn't require much. The pool was never overcrowded and the location is within walking distance to restaurants, bars, and convenience stores.

Stayed here for four nights in mid-September.  Room was clean, quiet and reasonably comfortable.  Had a king size bed along with a couch and a nice desk to work at.  Refrigerator was more like a freezer as almost everything I put in it got frozen.  The knob to turn down the temperature was broken, but not a big deal as mostly what I stored in it was water anyway.  

The breakfast is pretty much worthless.  Couple of different kinds of cereal, bananas, apples, juice and coffee.  Better than nothing, but just barely in my opinion.

Very easy location for doing things in and around Orange county.  All-in-all, I was pleased and would stay here again.

What I loved most was the offer of the hotel to take me to the shopping mall with the shuttle at no cost.
The proximity of the restaurants & the front desk guidance on choosing Menu thrilled me
Very happy overall and exceptionally pleased with service of Breakfast room attendant, Martha; very nice, warm smile, friendly and helpful.

Needed a economical place to stay  and this Traveloge met my requirements and more.  Great location, clean, wireless works, and a very nice pool and spa. The breakfast is a little thin , but good coffee!

My 2 kids and I stayed at this hotel for the weekend of Labor Day. The room we got seemed to be updated with many updates, and very cleaned I will recommend this room for a short stay. The pool for the kids was good, they offer a small continental breakfast nothing fancy just cereal, bagels coffee, orange juice. The hotel offered free wifi. Many little restaurant and convenience stores across the street

The excellent location made this place a good choice. The lobby was attractive and functional. The room was basically clean and neat, it just didn't look clean and neat ...it looked tired ...smelled well-used, old. The breakfast room for guests was very basic. Even so, it was fair value for the money.

The room was hot and horrible the tv didn't work. The bed stunk. Will never stay there again. Worst 100.00 ever spend and that was at a discount I couldn't imagine waisting more money on a sorry room.

Yes,  this is a budget- friendly motel!  The shower needed better ventilation which is causing the paint to peel,  but other than that, I found my room comfortable. It was spacious, and had a decent sleeper couch to sit on while I worked.  The sink area has been upgraded to a nice dark marble,  and it was very quiet overnight.  The property is very close to the airport so you shouldn't be surprised when planes take off,  but the noise ends between 10 pm and 6:30 am, so a quiet room overnight is the norm.  I will stay here again next time business brings me here!

The room was OK, it was bearable.  First of all, finding this place was a nightmare. It's not where Google maps shows it (I know that's not really their fault, but that's a pretty easy fix that the hotel can make).  The problem with this is that we called the front desk multiple times asking for directions, and the guy was so unhelpful it drove me crazy.  His inability to give simple directions such as major crossroads was unbelievable. 

The air conditioner was broken (1 of the fans wasn't working- we didn't realize until our last night, so that's on us).  They switched us to a new room, so at least that was nice.

One night I called the front desk asking for extra pillows and towels, and they said they'd call me back in 10 min.  I never got a call. 

The food for the breakfast was terrible but it's the same as any other 2 star hotel, except these people didn't even have a waffle maker.  It was basically cereal and bagels with some fruit. 

Overall, I would definitely not return..

Stayed here for a few days. Lots of complaints from us. I'm just going to list the problems we had so that others can be prepared for issues. First, they have too many cars in the parking lots. You can't find a place to park because of the used car dealership in the parking lot. The first day we were here, maintenance guys were washing loose tires and rims, as well as bicycles in the parking lot. They have a lot of crickets outside the doors that chirp all night...When having a shower, the water goes from hot to cold in 1 second, so the shampoo burns your eyes because you jump out from the freezing cold water. I also had a sunburn, and the showers water made this worse by the temp changes. I ended up just having a freezing cold shower because I couldn't wait all day. The shower head was clogged from hard water stains, so it only comes out on the hard pressure setting. It was like taking a shower with a garden hose. We didn't have enough towels, and the office was rude when we asked for clean towels. We started washing them ourselves to avoid the rudeness. The breakfast room had a roach crawling up the wall, next to the bananas.They had hookers out at night hanging over the upper balcony. I felt like I was staying at a low budget Motel 6. The queen size beds are actually full size beds, comfortable but tiny. Airplane noise didn't bother us. Tv's were nice. Fridge worked. I would move the used car lot out of the parking lot, and provide more towels for your guests. Because those were my main complaints. I wouldn't stay here again just because of those issues. I would have expected this from Motel 6 but for the price it didn't match the service. I would happily pay $100.00 to another hotel for clean fresh towels, and a place to park that was remotely close to my room. The maids seemed nice. Whomever manages this hotel, is not doing a good job, and probably lacks management skills. When you walk into the lobby, it looks very nice, but when you get your room, you will be sadly disappointed.
Old dirty couch and bedspread....shower was old and nasty.had to go to office for towels..only had 2 hand towels

We were attending a nearby class (one mile away) so we were at the Travelodge just to sleep.  Just two of us with 2 double beds for two nights.  Prices were good for online with AARP discount.  Great varied continental breakfast.  Easy choices to take and go, which we did.  Even the juices and milk and cereal were in small cartons.  Rooms were clean.  Beds made the second day.  Parking right in front as we requested.  If I have to find a negative, it's just that there was a slight smell of smoke outside the room but not inside.

Stayed five nights. Went well. Our room was nice. Checking in was fine. The last day there, I went to the lobby to use the computer to print my plane ticket for the next day in the morning...and the lady at the desk was talking to other customers there. First off, she sounded rude to them. Second off she gave me a weird like of confusion. Comes upto me and says "excuse me mam...are you a registered customer" I said "ummm" before I could say anything she said... "only registered customers can use the computers okay?" (Rudely) then I said "well my fiance and I are staying. Shes like "whats your room number" (I got confused with my room number. I said 224 insead of 245 for some reason) she goes and looks it up and says "yeah thats not your room" so I was trying to remember my room number. She says "why dont you go upstairs and have the person whos room its under and do it because only they can... because I dont want you to keep trying to guess your room number? Alright.?" She said it in a rude but super fake nice way. Did NOT appreciate it. Didnt say anything back because I didnt want to be rude to her. SO later that night I went back and asked the guy if I could use the computer. He said "yes you can" he was nice and did not question me about it. So I have no idea what was up with the lady earlier that day. She had long black and this was on the 27th of this month (may) just incase if the hotel is actually reading this review. Other than that...my review would have been a four. But after her...im leaving it a three. 

Other than that..it was good. Breakfast was small but convinient because I get hungry right away in the morning so it was nice.

After booking a non-smoking room, got a non-smoking room that reaked of awful smoke.  Second room was much better however upon washing up for the evening, saw their was a wet wash rag, used towel, and trash bucket filled with 2-3 of those wet kitty food containers and other personal trash items.  Exhaused, I let it go and went to bed.  Bed was horrible.  Basically what you imagine in a super cheap motel.  LInens seemed OK, but everything else was essentially 1950's Norman Bates Motel cheapo.  Sorry, while I appreciate an $85.00 room price, I see no reason not to have at least a good bed if nothing else.

Everyone was pleasant, room was clean, just rundown. Popcorn ceilings, older carpet. Shower worked, but tub refinishing was chipped and cracked, etc. 
freezer was completely covered with ice and therefore not accessible. Freezer was disappointing.
Room and furnishing were great. Noise level in room excellent, especially considering proximity to airport. Parking was adequate but tight. Internet connectivity was non-existend
Room did not represent the online photos. Airconditioner pulled out from wall and sitting on the floor. Bed stripped. Smoking and musty smelling.

So i stayed here recently, in preparation for the OC half-marathon. needless to say I was just looking for a clean room where I could get some sleep for the big race day. I will not be staying here again! I asked for a non-smoking room, and although the sticker on door said it was non-smoking the room smells like a cigarette, I was very unhappy with my stay. I did not sleep comfortably because of overwhelming smell of cigarettes. I felt like I had smoked a pack after my stay and my clothes also smelled like smoke when I got home. Non-smoking room, bull, excuse my French.

The room carpet is old, requires new carpet for this room.  The toilet fan is weak, odor stays longer when someone use the toilet.  Television is old, maybe it is time to change the TV to a flat HD model.

They put in a couple low quality flat screen tvs ( not in all rooms) and couches and call themselves charging 100 bucks for a roach infested room!

Very disgusting! Made me feel unbelievably uncomfortable!

They should change their rates to more like the MOTEL 6. Atleast then you know what to expect SMH!

Disgusted! I found a live beetle on my bed which made me feel uncomfortable throughout the night and did not sleep well. The power went out a few times throughout the night. In the morning while stepping into the shower, a huge, live cockroach was in there! There were also baby roaches by the toilet!

We were in a non-smoking room, but the room smelled of smoke.  We were offered another room, but it was upstairs and my husband is handicapped.  We were only there overnight anyway, so just put up with it for one night.  Everything else fine.

The price was great. The fridge in to room worked wonderful, the mattress was nice and flat. Unfortunately that is all I have for "good points".
The noise from the Airport was disturbing during the night, the walls are not very sound proof. The biggest bummer was just the grimy walls and beat up room furnishings, the only clean feeling spot in the room was the bed. (Thank goodness for at least that)
some of the front desk staff was rude   will never stay in this hotel again  bathroom was bad  and the continental breakfast was a joke

This is a good hotel, it is older but was well kept up, breakfast was great, they do allow dogs our room was in back so nice and quiet and overall had a good restful stay, we were between homes so we felt very at home here

I would like see through drapes to ensure privacy when heavy curtains are open.
I would prefer drinking out of cups and glasses rather than poly syrene and paper.
Clean rooms, good service.  Parking for 100 block of rooms is inadequate due to rental car business.  Due to this and handicapped parking it's almost impossible to get space close to room.

Clean room and friendly, helpful staff.  Great location with many food options nearby.  The large pool was great and the hot comp coffee in the morning was a nice plus.  Very close to the coast and great shopping.  I would readily recommend for the price.
We enjoyed our stay, and bed was comfortable as well as the pillows. We sleep the night through. Front desk and BK great.

We were made to feel welcome from the moment we entered the foyer to the delivery to SNA airport.  We did have opportunity to require a room later during our stay in the area, and happily  returned.  A different room, different bed and had a great stay for 2 more days.  Will definitely refer them.

The hotel front desk staff was a pure nightmare. They were so rude to me and my family. I went to ask for towels from them and I couldn't help but overhear them gossiping about one of their guests. I wont repeat what was said but they were so catty and down right rude. I decided I didn't need the towels because I felt bad for the guest they were insulting so I went back to my room.  There were roaches in my room at night. I told them about the bug problem and they looked at me as though I brought the 1000 roaches. I was mortified. I can not believe the rates of their rooms for such horrible quality. Please find yourself somewhere elese to stay.

Terrible internet access!!! Slower than dial-up.
Room are very durty.
Shower water keeps changing hot to cold. Very bad pressure.

I was given a smoking room and tols that was all that was left for a 4 day stay.  I was put in a 2nd floor room.  I'm 63 years old and don't get around too well, it was difficult to get my 45 Lb suitcase and breifcase up two flights of stairs.
For the most part, very good.  Weekday reasonable rates.  Rooms clean.  Could use better maintenance...commode loose causing intermittant refilll of water...

Lobby was clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was nice, clean. Bathroom is very tight. Close to SNA airport. Shuttle to airport was on time. Only drawback - I had two bags, both nearly 50# and I had to lug them up a flight of stairs. Ask for a room on the 1st floor if you are concerned about that. I didn't look/ask if there was an elevator.

It was just fine. But would try to stay in a diferent place next time. The tv in the room is great, bed is also good. But felt everything else really dirty. We didn't turn on the heater although it was really cold, because it was too dirty. In one morning the water didn't get hot. Breakfast was really just the basic..toast, muffin, cereal, juice and coffe...and it is served in a really small place that is also the reception. Didn't like so much, but was fine for the price you pay in Los Angeles.

Title Sums it up. Old out of date décor.
Old out of date amenities - better TV with hook ups.. 
Post Hours of Breakfast - Or Extend Hours of Breakfast - I showed up at 9:40 and door was locked. Hotel Staff said nothing about Breakfast or Hours.

We brought my two young children to California to take them to Disney. At one point they wanted to leave the park and come back to the hotel to swim :) The staff were so helpful and the rooms were clean though the bathroom was in need of updating. I still recommend this spot.

Our one night stay was OK.  However, if you just WANT a king size bed you're OK, but if you NEED a king size bed, do not stop here.  The "king" is a queen, and I'm sure that means that the "queen" is a double.  It was frustrating.  We would not stay here again because of this.  Everything else was OK.  We did not stay for the continental breakfast.

My husband and I stayed in room 146 of the Newport Beach Travelodge, for an overnight stay.  We liked the small, friendly hotel at a reasonable price, clean, able to park very near our room, a microwave and refrigerator with several restaurants right across the street.
We had a problem with the light over the table turning itself off every few minutes.  We reported this when it became evident, after dark, but were told the maintenance crew had left by then.  
The continental breakfast was just the minimum essentials.  Adequate, but no nice muffins or rolls.
We will probably stay there again.

In looking for nice and affordable lodging in Costa Mesa based on reviews by Trip Advisor, I chose this Travelodge and I'm glad I did. The rooms were excellent for the price. You get a flat screen TV, free wifi, a microwave and free breakfast. The pool was clean and inviting and the breakfast was fresh and there was a lot to choose from.

I would definitely stay here again.

I only stayed one night but the room was clean, the TV remote did not work but the maintenance man came to repair it right away.  They allowed me to check out late before leaving for the airport on their free shuttle.
Everything was close and easy access.  The day crew was much nicer than the graveyard shift. The night was just sleep walking through the motions.
Hope it was in the process of refurb.  1 room TV didn't work.  2nd room  plug for coffee pot didn't work
I have chosen this as my designated place to stay, whenever I am in Orange County. It is centrally located and is convenient to get to multiple activities.

The Travelodge was lovely. The staff I was great. They were courteous and friendly. There were some things wrong with our room and  the staff had them fixed right away. They offered to move us as soon as a room was available but we didn't wanted too. The cleaning technicians were great too. The view was very lovely. I will be back.

This is a conveniently located hotel offering clean, quiet rooms.  The staff was very friendly, and the room was well-appointed.  Close to OC attractions such as Disneyland, the beach, etc.  I will stay here again when in the area!

The hotel was good. They provided some good amenities, such as free shuttle to malls, airport and to the hotel where the conference were happening. Some of the staff members were great, others were just good. The breakfast was ok (would be nice if had more options). They also have a good, clean and large room. I would be there again.

I was pleasantly surprised.  My room was clean and comfortable, and the staff at the front desk was very helpful and quick in getting me into my room.  There were many good places to eat nearby and it only took me 5 minutes to get to JWA for an early check-in.

Our family of 4 stayed in this hotel to catch an early flight the next morning at Santa Ana Airport (5 minutes driving away). We arrived the previous day at 1 PM.
