The employees were nice but could not arrange us on the first (ground) floor. Please note that there is no lift and if you have several pieces of luggage (as we did) you have to carry it for 2 flight of stairs. The room is very dated and not really clean. It did smell like smoke (we booked a non smoking room). There were only 3 sets of towels and a couple were stained. Everything looks old and needing of a renovation. Up to this point we thought it was still ok, considering the low price obtained through Expedia. 
What I really did not like is that it looks like many people really LIVE in this lodge... open doors showed cluttered rooms, group of men drinking alcohol and smoking... at the pool I could confirm this impression by the bizarre stories of a very talkative and annoying man who said he had a car accident, no insurance and challenged the other people involved to sue him as "he had no money and lived in a motel". Not really the place where you feel at ease and for the first time I did not leave my 12 y.o. daughter walking alone to the ice machine!

The lady checking in my fiencee and I decided to pay for a pizza that was delivered and took the money out of the register to pay for it. Then didn't tip the guy. And she did this while I was trying to ask questions about my reservation. The delivery driver was more than willing to wait. The front desk clerk had no knowledge of the rooms or what was available. And was not friendly. The room was clean and in a great location.

I had a great stay at the Travelodge. On people service, the staff were very friendly, ready to please with a warm smile. I even got a pick-up and drop-off to the John Wayne Airport. :)  Now for the not so good bit, the carpet was infested with fleas, on complaining though, my room was changed and no worries moving forward.
this hotel was great. I was in a great location in between the activities my family and I were doing

I usually have stayed at the Travelodge located nearby in Costa Mesa. However, back in December 2012 I had to stay there again for a long period of time and not only were the staff rude and messed up my billing and bank account but the rooms were also in horrible shape and in need of remodeling. At this Travelodge, the staff all from the GM, housekeeping, and front desk were kind, considerate, and knowledgeable. The rooms were clean and well kept. I felt safe as I was a single female staying by myself and the staff looked after me while I was there. The breakfast was SENSATIONAL and the pool and spa were resort style. Totally recommend!!!

The room is very nice. Very pleased with everything. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Location is great.   Furniture is new and aesthetically pleasing.  I have no complaints. But be aware that it is right in line with the John Wayne airport and in the morning you will hear all the airplanes raking off.  Didnt bother us as we are early risers.  Would come back in a heartbeat if the price is right.

Strange exterior lighting.  Room decor unchanged since first Bush administration, i.e., aged and showing wear, but also a nice throwback.  However, everything works.  It's a fine place.  I felt safe. Staff is friendly.  Beds are firm.

After a long night of driving we looked forward to going to bed, unfortunately we did not get a very good nights sleep due to the fact that the bed was rock hard. In the morning there was lots of banging in the rooms around us from the house keepers. The bathroom was not only laid out very inconveniently but so gross that we didn't dare take a shower in it. We ended up canceling our second night because we were so displeased.

Our first room had several problems, so I asked for a different room and we were immediately moved to a very comfortable, stellar room! The swimming pool is beautiful. The front desk staff were very friendly and efficient. We stayed for a week and watched staff cleaning the pool area every morning and staff updating and painting rooms. Great location! We went to several beaches, hiked on trails at the Upper Newport Bay Ecological Preserve (3 blocks from the Travelodge), went on a day trip to Santa Catalina Island. The front desk staff were very helpful with planning excursions.

I don't spend much time in my hotel rooms.  However, when I open that door I like to feel exhilarated!  I did not get that feeling when I open my door to my room.  The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful!!  the rooms were old depressing, stains on the carpet, depressing lighting.  They really deed to be updated and improved!!  the location is great.

Stayed in room 206, it smelled old. The tv remote is worn out. I had them replace the batteries but it is just the buttons. The breakfast had no protein just carbs and not so great coffee. Otherwise it was fine.

Room was clean and staff was very friendly and curtious. Great area 20 min from Disneyland and 20 min to laguna beach. 8 min to Newport peir and beach!! Gym was not very good though and breakfast was just bagels and cereal.

We reserved the room a month or more in advance, being sure to ask for 2 beds in the back, away from the street. However, this was not available when we arrived so we had to take a room with one double bed on the ground floor and share! Needless to say, I was very uncomfortable sharing a small bed with a big friend. We were very disappointed.

We were put in the back section of the hotel near their dumpsters and the city wash  the room was old and  had evidence of mold and water damage by the bubbling wall paper and wall. The room smelled horrible. All the rooms on our side were perm. guests who live there we were told, were outside their rooms drinking and smoking and one couple was fighting . We asked for another room and it took the front  desk girl 30 mins to let us know our choice was a smoking room upstairs which we did not want we asked for non smoking. They had nothing else so we had to go out and find another hotel. Not happy after driving 4 hrs to get there.. Would never go back The front of the hotel and lobby are really nice but whats behind that is not what the front looks like.

Hotel stay was nice. Check in was easy and hassle free. Appreciated the free wireless internet and enjoyed the jacuzzi staying open late. Overall a decent nights stay and was the best deal in town. Thanks.

Great location, convenient to the airport and downtown Newport Beach. The room was of decent size and nice amenities such as the fridge and microwave. The only thing that really turned us away was the smell of the room. We chose a "non smoking" room and one would have to wonder if it really was. It was hard to tell what the smell was but it sure didn't smell like it was a naturally clean scent or aroma. Either from a chemical or leftover smoke. Or perhaps smoke seeping in from other rooms. Other than that the room was decent and fit our needs with it's competitive price for the area.

While the room was reasonably clean, there were so many issues with this room.  I think mostly it was in desperate need of a renovation.  The bed was really hard. The refrigerator made so much noise my husband unplugged it.  While the tub was a Jacuzzi tub, there was no plug.  My husband went to the front desk and they gave him a plug, but when he tried to run the Jacuzzi it only made a horrible loud noise, rattling the walls, but other than that, it didn't work!  The toilet paper holder was about 6 inches off the floor!  The hair dryer had been installed so that the cord is attached to the wall about 6 inches from the dryer, which makes it pretty difficult to dry your hair!  There was a wallpaper border that was missing in some areas, and nearly falling off in others.  There was only one electrical outlet available for use, and it was so loose that anything we tried to plug into it literally fell right out!  Outlets near the nightstands would be very helpful.  And last, but not least, the pillows on the bed were very tiny.  Sure could have used a few more.  

This hotel is in a great location, and the lobby is beautiful.  Perhaps they should spend some money on updating the rooms.  We would like to stay there again, only because it's so convenient for what we needed, but until they renovate the rooms, we'll have to stay at a location that's not quite as convenient as this one.

My 2nd time in this hotel for a week, sport tournament at Irvine University (5 minutes).
You can find all the points of interest of South Los Angeles near of you.
Excellent location, excellent services, the personal answers to all your questions.
A little bit noisy but for a hotel at 8 minutes of the Airport, it is excellent.
I highly recommend it!

Fully functional room  in great location for the airport and convenient base for driving around the general area (UCI, Newport Beach etc). Fixtures and fittings a little tired but this trades off against excellent value. Staff friendly and very helpful - kindly dried washing for me when out for evening and not back gefore laundry closed down for the night.

Thank you for your offer of accommodation. Went astray for the first time from Japan, had been exhausted at times for housing, we have deep emotion toward the front at the time of check-in staff will be happy to deal with gently. I have become very good memories.
It may be unpopular with the staff if you write such a thing, you're in the habit that the majority of the Japanese is that soothe your tired body fill the bathtub with hot water. If you have put a stopper can earn the hot water because it was not just the shower with bathtub.

The staff here is very nice, the room has everything I need, but it smells so bad!  My sinuses are hurting.  I think there is urine somewhere in the room on top of the musty smell.  If it weren't for this I would be very happy here.  They allow pets here and when I open up the window that smell comes in from the beautifully manicured lawn.  The price is so good, and the room is spacious, fridge, microwave, everything I need.  Too bad the smell.

I'm a Diamond Elite Member & have stayed at this hotel numerous times, both for business & pleasure, & have not had any problems until my recent stay. They put me in a room other than what I had reserved. The maids are very nosey & don't pay attention to the "Do Not Disturb" sign outside your door & will only clean your room when you're not around or will ask you to leave the room while they clean. 
During my last trip, the night manager had said there were complaints of me having too much traffic in my room, knowing I had only ONE (1) guest while staying there. When asked to speak to the manager, they refused, saying I could write a complaint & to leave the property. Five (5) minutes later, they called my room & said I could stay one more night.

If you enjoy the sound of constant planes taking off right above all day & night & waking up every morning to the gardners right outside your window with loud clowers & trimmers, than this is your hotel. Also there is a big population of people actually living there.

The room felt old from the start. The bathroom showed dirt i cracks and crevices. The toilet was loose from floor and would bang when you sit on it. There were no plugins available in the entire room. We will not be back.

The location was good for attending a show at the Segerstrom Center, and the hotel offered shuttle service there, which was a nice surprise. The picture quality of the TV in the room was not great, but that may not apply to all. The furnishings showed some wear and tear, but it was clean and quiet, and the price and location were fine for me. It was also very close to a lot of eateries.
outstanding and courteous staff, great free hotel transfer, nice pool/wirlpool, close to restaurants and 5 mins drive to airport. will come back definitely

We booked 2 nights at this Travelodge.  Staff were friendly at arrival/check in time.  We reserved a room with two queen beds.

At the time of our check in, a "suspicious" looking woman (guest?) Interrupted our check in process by demanding a key to a room.  She was informed by the staff who checked their computer system that she "was not requested" in that room (!!!!). I think this should have been our clue to turn around and run as fast as possible, but it was late and we were very tired and nowhere else to go so we finished our check in.

Upon our.arrival in our non-smoking room, we encountered a room with worn out, filthy stained carpets.  Tried to open a night stand drawer and the front fell off! Bathroom light was covered with a thick fuzzy blanket of dirt/dust.  Chairs were badly stained with something black.  Couldn't sit on it, and definitely would advise against walking on the carpet barefoot!  The room reeked of.cigarette smell.  There was an old banana left in the microwave (by previous guest??), and to top it all off, an EMPTY condom wrapper Left behind in the trash can!!

As we had nowhere else to go and were exhausted after a long drive, we actually stayed and suffered through the night, trying to get some sleep while fighting our feelings of revulsion.

We complained the next morning to the, management, and to their credit, they refunded us both nites.  They were very apologetic.  We found another place to stay the second nite.

will NEVER book this place again!

Stayed 8/9/12 Thurs eve. Felt as if we were a pain for the front desk clerk to work with except for running my credit card through for payment. Asked about the shuttle to the airport and were told it doesn't start until 6:30 am and had to be scheduled. Thankfully we had a rental car that I could hold for one more night and return or we would probably have missed our flight relying on this place for a shuttle. 

Got to our room, and we had one bath towel, and 2 washcloths for 3 people. When I called the front desk for additional towels, the phone rang and rang, finally the clerk picked up and I was told to "come down and get them." I asked why and was told that there was "no one here tonight to bring them to the room." When I got to the front desk there was the front desk clerk and one other staff member; both went to a back room to get the towels. I don't like being lied to.

When we had checked in I asked if it was automatic check-out and I was told I had to come to the front desk in the morning. When I arrived in the morning at 5:30 am, no one was at the front desk, I called out twice "hello, " no surprises there, so I grabbed a piece of paper from the printer and wrote a note that we were checking out. The same clerk came out from the back rubbing his eyes.  I said we're checking out is there anything for me to sign, he said "no." Big waste of my time coming to the front desk to deal with this guy for the last time. 

As for the room, ok on cleanliness. Doors open to the outside, air conditioner is a window mount, very noisy and not very cold air. Refrigerator worked well. Stain on the blanket--when I saw that automatically pulled the bed apart to check for bugs. There was a carpet tack on the floor which I stepped on. The bathroom had a toilet roll dispenser about 5 inches from the floor, that seemed like a creative construction trick to say the least. The bathtub drained backwards into the tub rather than into the drain. Bottom of shower curtain had mold. 

Basically stayed here because it was going to be a short night. I wouldn't recommend on spending more than one night here. It is "bare-bones" --that's it. 

Parking lot fills up fast, nothing on one side where most of the hotel is (behind the pool). 

I really can't believe that these hotels/motels don't have standards from one hotel to the next (eg in order to get the Travelodge designation you have to meet standard requirements). The decorative "lighting" in the front windows is more tacky than welcoming.

I've stayed here five times now. The experience is consistent: the Travelodge Orange County Airport delivers a decent room for a very low price. You're plenty close to the beach area, John Wayne Airport, and a nexus of freeways that will take you anywhere in the greater LA-Orange County area. The decor and furnishings are aging, but they're aging gracefully :). And again, I feel as if I got at least what I paid for when it comes to hot water, a comfortable bed, a decent cable lineup, and very convenient free parking and Internet. The in-room microwave and fridge are all I really need. The blackout curtains made my room utterly dark and restful. You don't hear the jets from the airport between about 9 p.m. and 8 a.m., because of local regulations. There's a small but decently equipped exercise room. You're easy walking distance from restaurants, both fast-food and casual dining, and there are two convenience stores right across the street. When it's time for a remodeling, I'm sure they'll put in some more stylin' bedding and fixtures, but in the meantime, it's still a great place to lay your head at night. Take the money you save by staying here and splurge at South Coast Plaza, The Camp, or the legendary Hi-Time Wine Cellars in nearby Newport Beach.

They offer free shuttle to and from airport, as well as to the Amen Clinic! Our check in & check out was fast, efficient and no billing errors. I was in room 125 in the back, no noise & hotel is conveniently located. Our room was clean, all amenities in the room functioned properly (fridge, microwave, tv, blowdryer, coffee maker) . Beds were comfortable, rooms smelled clean and the a/c - heater worked, we tried both. It's not a five star hotel, but for a night or 3 night stay in  my case, I feel it was well worth it; I got a good deal on the internet. The grounds were immaculate and beautiful & they also have a car rental in the lobby! The only complaint I have is the art work in the room was outdated, but it appears they are updating all of the rooms as a couple of rooms down from mine was completely gutted and being remodeled. The continental breakfast consisted of juice, milk, coffee, bagels, english muffins, fresh fruit and cereal; enough to get your day started. It was served in 2 adjacent rooms which provided numerous tables to sit at with a flat screen to watch the news.   The pool was medium size, it looked clean and the hot tub was definitely hot; it also looked clean. There was a nice grill in the pool area also.  All of the staff I had contact with were very friendly and willing to help. I think they have made many changes over the last couple of years.

Actually felt like I blew it. I had other choices on my I-phone at about the same price. I just happened by here and wanted to get the room rental out of the way, Probably should have waited. Room was sufficient for a quick overnight stay.

I was flying in with kids 8, 5 and 16 months, and arriving late (10:45 PM).  We were renting a van at the airport the next day to drive down to Carlsbad (for Legoland), and just needed a place close the airport for the overnight.  I limited my search to hotels that had free airport shuttle.  When I arrived I called for the shuttle.  They said "we don't have a shuttle."  After stating that thier site said they do, he said they don't have one "at this time of night."  They offered to comp me cab fare.  This is what we did.  When I arrived, I pressed him a bit, and it turns out that thier shuttle drivers is "on vacation."  That seems a little lame.  They did, however, also comp the taxi back to the airport to pick up my rental.
The room was fine.  A little dingy, but for "cheap near the airport," you have to kind of expect that.
If I fly in like this again (unlikely), I would probably stay there again, but I would verify the shuttle before hand.

I booked this hotel, I confess, because it was the cheapest place I could find in all of south-central Orange County. I wasn't expecting much, so I was delighted to find it quiet, scrupulously clean, and equipped with all the things I want: free Internet (why do "premium" hotels feel they can charge for this? Internet is Internet), free parking (see previous comment), a nice fridge to store supplies for the room picnics I enjoy, a good TV with a well-above-average cable lineup, a comfortable bed, effective heat and A/C, and plenty of hot water in the shower. For a hotel this inexpensive, any kind of breakfast would be a bonus, so I wasn't disappointed at the modest offerings in the breakfast room. They saved even a few more bucks, so who can complain? I didn't even have to buy a newspaper -- they were in the lobby. I disagree with a previous commenter who thought the furnishings were gauche -- they were just motel basic, not raggedy and kitschy, just unremarkable. It's close to the airport, but I heard only a few flights taking off, partly because the takeoffs were angled away from the motel, and partly because OC is zealous about not allowing taking-off jets to be noisy. They have to throttle back after taking off, and they don't fly late at night or early in the morning. This stretch of Bristol is bland, but only a few miles up the road are South Coast Plaza, one of the highest-grossing and fanciest malls in the country (nearby are theaters, music venues as well). Even closer is a pair of "anti-malls" that any younger person would find delightful; these are shops selling handmade crafts, organic and quirky food, amazing bicycles, cool outdoorsy wear, and more (one of these malls is called "The Camp," and it looks like a permanent village set up by the world's smartest hippies. The other, across a busy street, is called "The Lab," with similar goodies plus performance possibilities).

Anyway, you could do much, much worse, and you probably have, if you prowl for cheap rooms the way I do. This Travelodge was well worth it for the budget travelers.

This hotel was such a steal!

$68.70/night for a king sized comfortable bed (Run Of The House Rate on reservation) with a 42" LCD plasma screen tv (HDMI compatible for gaming and laptop), continental breakfast, and was only 2 miles away from food and the party we were crashing.

If you're rainbow friendly; the Tin Lizzie Saloon is around the corner and it's always gay night every night.

The room was so large roomy and comfortable we felt at home straight off the bat.I was here with my girlfriend and she was so impressed and so happy that this place turned out pretty awesome!
It's real close to the John Wayne Airport; has a laundromat; pool & jacuzzi (did not go swimming so I wouldn't know), and also exercise room.

Only gripe was that the internet was slow but it was available, the fact that the parking was only so-so, our room was right next to sewage (gross but did not stink so long as we were in the room), and the cleaning ladies were waiting on us to get out stuff out and check out. The front desk people are awesome!

Continental Breakfast:
Assorted Bagels, cereal, oatmeal, english muffins, apples, oranges, and bananas.
Drinks: OJ, apple juice, tea, coffee and milk.

Bathtub had a crack but it was obviously repaired in the past.

The best part was that when you book on a weekday you get 20% off discount on each night so if you book a stay for a Monday - Friday weekday. (includes weekends if you book with weekday stay)

Check in was at 3pm however if you're going to check in later leave it in Customer Comments; checkout was at noon.

I was really excited to take my boyfriend and three teenagers on this trip -- a family wedding with some tourist activity tacked on.  We had taken an early flight, spent half the day at Universal Studios, then sought the hotel for some rest before the wedding, shower, etc. Unfortunately Google map directions were way wrong [not sure whose fault that is ...]  so it took a good 30 minutes more to find it, even with an active GPS too.

When we checked in, the clerk was extremely friendly, but we were met with the AWFUL news that the pool and spa were out of service for maintenance. Surely between Priceline and the hotel there would be some way to notify a leisure traveler?  Anyway, let's not blame the hotel.

The rooms were decorated in the most eye-searing fabrics -- bedspreads, curtains, oy vey! Who was thinking what? But both rooms appeared very clean, and we liked the large vanity /countertop for the sink. Microwave and fridge? Two thumbs up! An ice-caked freezer in which you couldn't actually fit anything? Thumbs down. Clean tub & shower? Thumbs up. No fan in the bathroom? Thumbs down.

There was no 'privacy' door hanger, then it was an unpleasant surprise the next morning when housekeeping came knocking at 9. We asked them to come back at 11, then filtered downstairs for the "premium" continental breakfast. NOTHING premium -- boxed cereals, bagels, no recycling, and the threat of being interrogated about your room before you could eat. Fortunately that showdown never came to pass.

Saturday was a fun day, full day at Universal Studios, general exploring. We came back after dinner with the intent of hanging out & relaxing. One grumpy guy [perhaps a long-time guest/resident] told my girls to be quiet -- they were giggling when knocking on the door of the room my son was staying in. It was 10 PM, and they were a couple of giggling teenagers. CHILL, mister.

Sunday dawned brightly over the empty pool and jacuzzi :-( and as we were preparing to pack the car and checkout there was a cluster of 5 young men in the breezeway near one of our rooms. The aroma of illegal herbs was strong as I came around the corner to take the stairs down.  Eventually we had to call hotel staff to have them removed. This is unfortunate and was uncomfortable because there were plenty of housekeepers rolling their carts back and forth so they should have seen.

At check out, again the service was really great. Thanks for the mint!

Air noise from the county airport wasn't too bad, access to freeway was decent, so all in all I'll give it a thumbs up ... with an asterisk.  Good luck to you!

It was easy to get there from John Wayne(OC) Airport, especially making use of the complimentary shuttle. I have even visited before from LAX - self-drive, and the hotel is situated centrally in the heart of OC. It has a welcoming exterior, simple, in keeping with Travelodge, but cared for and tended.
I was greeted in the lobby with pleasant efficiency and nothing was too much trouble. This would probably be the perfect hub for business trips too. But I was on holiday. Walking passed the pools to my room, the water looked clean and inviting.

My room was ambient; someone had designed it 'home-from-home', it seemed just for me, and the message read that if anything was lacking they would do their utmost to rectify it. I found nothing however was lacking: It was perfectly comfortable (dare I say upmarket for a Travelodge) - I was quite taken aback by the thoughtful attention to detail and amenities, and I felt safe. 
The breakfast was simple and well considered. Not just a pile of donuts, but fresh juice and fruit, coffee, cereals and breads and English muffins to toast.
At night I could walk a few yards to a choice of lively local eateries, or take a short drive to the bustling bars and bistros on Newport Coast. 
The hotel is convenient for the classy shopping malls, (Spectrum, Fashion Island and South Coast Plaza) and a couple of trendy, funky 'anti-malls' are really close by...worth a look! 

There are beautiful Soca golf courses - one backing onto the hotel, - and all manner of visitor attractions locally, including Disneyland and Universal. I had easy access to the freeways, South to San Diego, East to the Coacella Valley Desert, North to downtown LA, or a short hop West to the glorious coastal villages which cater for chic and surf alike!

Now don't get me wrong, - we are not looking at the elite, top-notch, dollar-guzzling end of the market; - this is not a five star, plush, marbled, palace...but it certainly aspires to be one, and should have five stars for effort! So for comfort, care, cleanliness, convenience and considerable value I would award this particular unique Travelodge an A+ *.

I travel frequently and have had the opportunity to stay in several hotels.  The location is perfect when flying into John Wayne, this hotel has it all.  Friendly staff, clean quiet rooms,
shuttle service, business center, continental breakfast.  What more could you ask for?  Superb value.

This is an excellent hotel, very good located, close to the OC Santa 
Ana Airport John Wayne (3 minutes by car, only), better that LAX Aiport. If you are travelling to the south of California or going to Disneyland... excellent hotel and excellent location. It has a reasonable price and a good breakfast. Close, you can find 
restaurants, etc. Moreover, there are several "latinos" working, so, if you do not speak 
English they can help you. I go there from Madrid (Spain)

This is very nice, average motel, near Newport Beach, and Disneyland. The rooms were clean, and each had a fridge and a microwave. The a/c unit has a "fan only" option, so we turned that on at night, for white noise, and we didn't hear a single thing from outside or the rooms around us. The breakfast was free, standard fare: cold cereal, bagels, fruit. 
The front desk staff was very friendly; we had to change our reservation dates at the last minute, and they were very accomadating. 
We never used the pool, but we went by it, and it was large, appeared very clean and private.
Overall, for the price, it's a great deal. It's not fancy, but it's kept up, good location, and a perfect "home base" if you are planning to do a lot of site seeing, and need a place to come rest and regroup. I will absolutely be staying again next summer.
The ONE thing I would caution: make sure to use mapquest., as the maps make it look like it is right off the freeway, but it is actually kind of tricky to get to, if you don't know your way around the town, which we didn't.

The absolute most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed at.  Bed was full of bedbugs, some big, some small, jumping all over the place.  The proprietors and Travelodge should be ashamed of themselves.  A rotten, flea bitten (literally) dump.  Sleep in your car if you have to but don't stay here.
